summary:
Russia launched a large, coordinated attack on Ukraine today as Kyiv said it struck refineries in response. Ukrainian officials reported strikes across 14 regions, with casualties including at least one dead and dozens injured, and separate early reports said a major strike on the capital killed at least 19 people, including children. Authorities also reported waves of drones overnight that damaged power infrastructure in Odesa and Chernihiv, leaving about 60,000 households without electricity and prompting Kyiv to vow retaliation. Fighting continues to disrupt civilian life and energy supplies across the country.

Elsewhere, world leaders met in China at a regional security summit where Vladimir Putin and Narendra Modi joined about 20 others, underscoring shifting diplomatic alignments and a focus on regional stability. In New York, the United States blocked a Palestinian leader from attending a UN meeting even as France pushes recognition of Palestinian statehood, highlighting divisions in international diplomacy. Israel said a strike killed Hamas spokesman Abu Obeida, a claim not yet independently verified. Researchers warned that climate change is slowing hurricanes and increasing rainfall, raising new risks for coastal communities, while Ukraineâ€™s president rejected buffer zone proposals, signaling continued resistance to demilitarization offers.

headlines.title: Russia launches large attack on Ukraine as Kyiv targets refineries
headlines.summary: Kyiv reports strikes across 14 regions, with casualties reported including at least one dead and dozens injured so far.

headlines.title: Russia carries out deadly attack on Kyiv, reports say
headlines.summary: A major strike hits Ukraine's capital, killing at least 19 people, including children, according to early reports from authorities.

headlines.title: Putin, Modi join others at China regional security summit
headlines.summary: Putin and Modi attend a regional security summit in China with about 20 other world leaders as part of a broader gathering.

headlines.title: Climate change is intensifying hurricanes, researchers say
headlines.summary: Recent analysis links storms slowing and increasing rainfall to warming oceans, highlighting heightened risks and adaptation challenges for coasts.

headlines.title: Ukraine vows retaliation after drone strikes cut power
headlines.summary: Russia launches 142 drones overnight, hitting energy sites in Odesa and Chernihiv, leaving about 60,000 households without power.

headlines.title: US blocks Palestinian leader from attending UN meeting in New York
headlines.summary: The move coincides with international efforts led by France to push for Palestinian state recognition at next month's UN gathering.

headlines.title: Zelensky rejects buffer zone proposals to end Ukraine war
headlines.summary: Zelensky argues buffer zones would ignore modern warfare realities, signaling no concession to demilitarization plans as long-term strategy.

headlines.title: Hamas spokesman Abu Obeida killed in Gaza strike, Israel says
headlines.summary: Israel says the military strike killed Hamas's public spokesperson; Hamas has not confirmed the death, as the conflict widens and verification remains incomplete.
